title: Traffic Accident Severity Prediction Modeling Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistics, linear algebra, and fundamental machine learning concepts
context.additional_context: Multi-task deep learning model development utilizing real traffic accident data and interpretability analysis

learning_goals: Design a system classifying traffic accident severity (casualty/property damage) into three levels using a multi-task deep learning model

Learners generate relevance maps for specific predictions (e.g., image classification) of deep learning models (e.g., CNN) using the Layer-wise Relevance Propagation (LRP) technique, visualize them as heatmaps, and explain them based on ≥3 interpretation criteria (e.g., pixel importance, regional concentration, class consistency).

Learners implement the full process of applying ≥3 data preprocessing techniques (missing value handling, normalization, outlier removal, etc.) to a given dataset using Python, building 1 classification or regression model with Scikit-learn or TensorFlow/Keras, and evaluating performance via ≥4 metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
